dev/lsf/asio/async/epoll_event_driver.hpp

00001 // File:        epoll_event_driver.hpp
00002 // Description: ---
00003 // Notes:       ---
00004 // Author:      leoxiang <leoxiang727@qq.com>
00005 // Revision:    2012-06-12 by leoxiang
00006 
00007 #pragma once
00008 #include <sys/epoll.h>
00009 #include "lsf/asio/async/basic_event_driver.hpp"
00010 #include "lsf/util/backtrace.hpp"
00011 
00012 namespace lsf {
00013 namespace asio {
00014 namespace async {
00015 
00017 // EpollEvent
00019 class EpollEventDriver : public BasicEventDriver {
00020 public:
00021     static const size_t MAX_EV_NUM = 128;
00022 
00023 public:
00024     EpollEventDriver() { _epfd = ErrWrap(::epoll_create(128000)); } // this size is not used nowadays, see man
00025 
00026     bool RegisterEvent(int fd, int flag) {
00027         if (!(flag & FLAG_READ) && !(flag & FLAG_WRITE)) return false;
00028 
00029         epoll_event ev = {0, {0}};
00030         ev.data.fd = fd;
00031         ev.events |= (EPOLLERR | EPOLLHUP);
00032         // here we use EPOLLRDHUP to make epoll aware of peer close connection
00033         // or shutdown write-half of the connection, see epoll_ctl for more
00034         if (flag & FLAG_READ) ev.events |= EPOLLIN;
00035         if (flag & FLAG_WRITE) ev.events |= EPOLLOUT;
00036 
00037         // try mod
00038         int res = ErrWrap(::epoll_ctl(_epfd, EPOLL_CTL_MOD, fd, &ev));
00039         if (res == 0) return true;
00040         if (errno != ENOENT) return false;
00041 
00042         // try add
00043         if (ErrWrap(::epoll_ctl(_epfd, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, fd, &ev)) == 0) {
00044             _fds_size++;
00045             return true;
00046         }
00047         return false;
00048     }
00049 
00050     void CancelEvent(int fd) {
00051         if (::epoll_ctl(_epfd, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, fd, NULL) == 0) _fds_size--;
00052     }
00053 
00054     bool WaitEvent(int timeout) {
00055         _cur_pos = 0;
00056         int ret = ErrWrap(::epoll_wait(_epfd, _evs, MAX_EV_NUM, timeout));
00057         _max_evs = std::max(0, ret);
00058         return ret >= 0;
00059     }
00060 
00061     bool GetReadyEvent(int* pfd, int* pflag) {
00062         if (_cur_pos >= _max_evs) return false;
00063 
00064         *pflag = 0;
00065         if (_evs[_cur_pos].events & EPOLLIN) *pflag |= FLAG_READ;
00066         if (_evs[_cur_pos].events & EPOLLOUT) *pflag |= FLAG_WRITE;
00067         if (_evs[_cur_pos].events & EPOLLERR) *pflag |= FLAG_ERR;
00068         if (_evs[_cur_pos].events & EPOLLHUP) *pflag |= FLAG_ERR;
00069 
00070         *pfd = _evs[_cur_pos].data.fd;
00071 
00072         _cur_pos++;
00073         return true;
00074     }
00075 
00076     size_t GetRegisterEventSize() const { return _fds_size; }
00077 
00078 private:
00079     int _epfd = 0;
00080     size_t _max_evs = 0;
00081     size_t _cur_pos = 0;
00082     size_t _fds_size = 0;
00083     epoll_event _evs[MAX_EV_NUM];
00084 };
00085 
00086 }  // end of namespace async
00087 }  // end of namespace asio
00088 }  // end of namespace lsf
00089
